Contributor: Perry, Raymond, artist.; Victory Liberty Loan Committee.;
Note: Signed "Raym Perry." Date based on date of the Victory Liberty Loan campaign. Orientation: Vertical.
Description: Design for a newspaper and magazine advertisement for the Victory Liberty Loan campaign.  The text tells about Andrew B. Lynch, 2nd Lieutenant, 110th Infantry, who received a citation of honor for gallantry for rescuing an officer who had been captured by an enemy patrol. Andrew B. Lynch was a Philadelphian who upheld the honor of his city and country. Text says to "lend as Lynch fought." Illustration shows a portrait of Andrew B. Lynch. Three men fighting are seen behind his portrait.
Digital Collection: Allied Posters of World War I

Title: America's immortals : Andrew B. Lynch.
